titlestmt.titleproper: Eugene Bolt curatorial files and Mineral Catalogue projects 1989-1994
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Eugene Bolt curatorial files and Mineral Catalogue projects

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. Eugene A. Bolt was Curator at the Wagner Free Institute of Science from 1989 to 1994.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials Bolt's office. Included are records that document the research and implementation of the Mineral Collections Cataloging project undertaken at the Wagner in 1989-1990. There are data collection worksheets for 11 cases of mineral specimens, and a printout of an inventory for one of the cases. Also included are correspondence and other documents from 1990-1994 concerning the transfer of the Academy of Natural Science's mineral collection to the Wagner. Finally, there are newsletters and correspondence from various local area mineralogical societies, and reprints and photocopies of articles on mineralogy.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
